intro: Ridleyandra stellata, commonly known as the star-leafed ridleyandra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Ridleyandra stellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
